title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators

content.rendered:
What are Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators?

Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators enforce and investigate matters around the law.

Where do Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators work?

  • Government

How much do Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators is $60,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Criminal justice majors
  • Biology majors
Search relevant jobs

Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators succeed in their work:

  • Empathy
  • Strong communication skills
  • Team building skills

What are some common questions about Police, Patrol Officers, Detectives, and Criminal Investigators?

Q: What rank comes after officer?

A: Detective.
